column4: when I open a program like art theme manager, and try to locate files that I downloaded
it brings up a 'save as' window, and it shows me where the recent files have been downloaded down to..it shows me a folder names tmp, for temporary
located under another folder called .gnome and this one is located under a folder named .gnome 2 and so forth till i come to the root folder
now when I try to open the root folder from my desktop, I don't see these folders at all
how can I access those folders?
anyone?
can anyone help me with this problem
I'm looking for folders that I cannot locate them under the roof folder
no I didn't mean that..
simply put, there are folder called .gnome and .gnome 2 which are located under the root folder
your user isn't able to see the folders in there.
what are you trying to do?
hit ctrl+h in nautilus
in the file browser folders with . in front are hidden.
also you shouldn't really be logged in as root but thats another issue.
yeap
its more than a security issue
you just enter the root password and do that.
no.
its nothing like windows.
use your normal user acount and if you want to install drivers or software it will prompt you for root password.  You enter it and away it goes.
you need to read the link from ubotu about sudo
